edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • edu.lafayette.bci.sigproc.Graph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class Graph
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    Represents a window of data (either raw or processed). Graph is also capable of displaying itself in a GUI application based on the given scale. The setWindowSize(int) method must be called when the graph is created or no points will be added to the Graph. This class is thread safe.
    Author:
    Haley Garrison
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Creates a new graph with a data queue.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<Point> getData()
        Returns the data contained in this graph.
        Returns:
        The queue containing this graph's processed data.

      • getPipeline

        public Pipeline getPipeline()
        Returns the pipeline contained in this graph.
        Returns:
        This graph's pipeline.

      • setScale

        public void setScale(double x,
            double y)
        This method must be called to set the scale of the graph for GUI applications or no graph will be shown.
        Parameters:
        x - Max x-axis span of data points
        y - Max peak-to-peak distance of data points

      • setWindowSize

        public void setWindowSize(int size)
        Determines the maximum number of points kept at one time. This method must be called or no points will be kept.
        Parameters:
        size - The number of samples kept for this graph.

      • setAxisLabels

        public void setAxisLabels(java.lang.String xLabel,
                 java.lang.String yLabel)
        Sets the labels for the x and y axes that will be displayed when this graph is added to a GUI application
        Parameters:
        xLabel - The title of the x axis
        yLabel - The title of the y axis

      • setAutoRepaint

        public void setAutoRepaint(boolean autoRepaint)
        Indicates whether the graph should automatically repaint when a new point is added. This value is true by default. If auto repaint is disabled, the repaint() method must be called manually.
        Parameters:
        autoRepaint - False to disable auto-repainting

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        Pause or unpause the graph. Pausing prevents new data from being added and old data from being removed.
        Parameters:
        paused - True to pause the graph

      • addPipeline

        public void addPipeline(Pipeline p)
        Adds a signal processing pipeline to this graph. Null removes the pipeline and data will be left unprocessed
        Parameters:
        p - The pipeline to add.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(Point p)
        Adds a point to this graph, passing it through the pipeline if there is one.
        Parameters:
        p - The new point to process and add to the graph.

      • toCSV

        public java.lang.String toCSV()
        Returns this graph's data formatted as CSV data. X values of the points are in the first column and Y values in the second
        Returns:
        This graph's comma separated data

      • fromCSV

        public void fromCSV(java.lang.String csv)
        Sets this graph's data from a CSV string. The csv string must have two columns, each labeled with the axis title. The first column will be treated as the x-axis values and the second column will be treated as the y-axis values.
        Parameters:
        csv - The CSV string to parse

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws a graphical representation of the graph.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
